text: Robert Arnold Schürhoff Martineau (22 August 1913 – 28 June 1999) was a British bishop who was the first Bishop of Huntingdon and who was later translated to Blackburn. Born in Birmingham and educated at King Edward's SchoolWho Was Who 1897–2007. London, A & C Black, 2007 and Trinity Hall, Cambridge, he was ordained in 1938. His first post was as a curate at MelkshamIndependent Obituary after which he was a World War II chaplain in the RAFVR. When peace returned he became Vicar of Ovenden, Halifax, and then Allerton, Merseyside,Crockfords,(London, Church House 1975) before his ordination to the episcopate.Bishop Of Huntingdon, The Times, 18 October 1965; pg. 12; Issue 56451; col G He died in Denbigh, Clwyd. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1999 deaths Category:People educated at King Edward's School, Birmingham Category:Alumni of Trinity Hall, Cambridge Category:Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve personnel of World War II Category:Bishops of Huntingdon Category:Bishops of Blackburn Category:People from Birmingham, West Midlands Category:Royal Air Force chaplains Category:World War II chaplains
